intro: Cypella brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian cypella, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
